title: Banor Foundation
subtitle: Youth Workforce Development
description: Nonprofit arm training youth in trade skills, certification tracks, and employment pathways into redevelopment.
intro: Banor Foundation prepares young people for careers in construction and redevelopment. Certified graduates enter the Development employment pathway—closing the workforce gap while building community.

items.title: Trade Skill Training
items.description: Hands-on training in carpentry, electrical, HVAC, and general construction. Industry-certified instructors.

items.title: Certification Tracks
items.description: OSHA 10, NCCER credentials, and state licensing pathways. Stackable credentials for career advancement.

items.title: Employment Pathway
items.description: Direct placement into Banor Development projects and partner employers. Paid internships and apprenticeships.

items.title: Community Restoration
items.description: Service projects that pair training with neighborhood improvement. Learn while you build.

items.quote: Banor gave me a real path. I'm a lead carpenter now, 18 months in. This program changed everything.
items.author: Marcus J., Lead Carpenter, Banor Development

items.quote: The certification opened doors I didn't know existed. I'm earning $22 an hour with full benefits.
items.author: Destiny L., HVAC Technician

items.quote: 78% of our cohort got placed within 90 days. The employment pathway actually works.
items.author: Cohort 12 Graduate

sections.title: Support the Foundation
sections.content: Philanthropic partners and program donors—invest in workforce development.
